title: "Vital Speeches" engraved/inline/openface serif
content:
Hi gang,

A colleague of mine needs help identifying the face used in the words "VITAL SPEECHES," and I'm drawing a blank. It's not:

- Caslon Openface  
- any of the Handtooled families from ITC (Century, Garamond, Cheltenham)  
- Acanthus Open  
- Narcissus  
- Academy Engraved  
- Monotype Old Face

The A is one of the distinctive characters.

(And yes, I know that the TA pair needs to be kerned, and that "of the day" is Trajan.)

Thanks!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150124044805im_/http:/typophile.com/files/vital_speeches_4976.jpg)
author: marcox

comments.content:
Hmm...  
Its not Smaragd or Castellar either...

António
Nah, it's not Chevalier. Lots of differences if you look closely.
That S looks about to feint.
